article:
'Coolhunting' is a term coined in the early 1990s referring to a new breed of
marketing professionals, called 'coolhunters'. It is their job to make
observations and predictions in changes of new or existing cultural trends. The
word derives from the aesthetic of "cool".

In this they resemble the intuitive fashion magazine editors of the 1960s such
as Nancy White ([[Harper's Bazaar]] 1958â1971). Coolhunters operate most notably
in the world of street fashion and design, but their work also blurs into that
of futurists such as Faith Popcorn. Many webloggers now serve as online
coolhunters, in a variety of cultural and technological areas.
